For the sketch, create a new face and draw the following features in sequence: 1. Line: Start Point (0.0, 0.0) and End Point (0.2298, 0.0) 2. Line: Start Point (0.2298, 0.0) and End Point (0.2298, 0.1887) 3. Line: Start Point (0.2298, 0.1887) and End Point (0.0, 0.1887) 4. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.2298. This will create a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.2298 - Width: 0.375 - Height: 0.2298 Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom Design a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 degrees and a translation vector of 0.0308, 0.0554, and 0.1887 in the x, y, and z directions, respectively. For the sketch, create a new face and draw the following feature in sequence: 1. Circle: Center (0.048, 0.048) and Radius 0.048 Extrude the two-dimensional sketch into a 3D model using an extrusion depth of 0.075 towards the normal direction of the face. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.096. This will create a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.096 - Width: 0.096 - Height: 0.075</description>
